goal.core.kr

Interface KRlanguage


  • public interface KRlanguage
    The knowledge representation (KR) service. A knowledge representation service provides the following:
    • Its name.
    • A method for initializing the KR to enable it to process a GOAL agent program.
    • A method for creating a database.
    • A method for resetting the KR service.
    • A compiler for compiling GOAL rules into the KR language.
    • A parser for parsing expression from the KR language.
    • A method for parsing individual updates.
    • A few other language related methods.
    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name of the KR service.

      • initialize

        void initialize(GOALProgram program,
              java.lang.String agentname)
                throws KRInitFailedException
        Performs knowledge representation specific initializations BEFORE the knowledge representation technology can be used by a particular GOAL agent to set up its mental state, if needed.
        Parameters:
        program - the GOAL agent program that contains information necessary for initialization.
        agentname - the name of the GOAL agent
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException - if initialization of kr technology fails.

      • makeDatabase

        Database makeDatabase(BASETYPE type,
                    java.util.Collection<DatabaseFormula> content,
                    java.lang.String agent)
                      throws KRInitFailedException
        Creates new database using the content. It is the responsibility of the KR technology to differentiate databases (e.g. by associating unique identifiers with a database).
        Parameters:
        type - database type, i.e. belief base, goal base, mailbox, percept base.
        content - set of formulas to be inserted to database.
        agent - agent that requests the database. This name is used as database identifier, and should have a unique name for each new agent.
        Returns:
        database that has been created.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException

      • reset

        void reset()
           throws KRInitFailedException
        Reset the language. Clears the databases and stops all queries.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException

      • getCompiler

        KRCompiler getCompiler()
        Returns:
        KRCompiler, or null if not available. If available, GOAL must use it to compile rules.

      • getParser

        EmbeddedKRParser getParser(org.antlr.runtime.ANTLRReaderStream cs,
                         java.io.File sourceFile)
                           throws ExtendedParserException
        get a parser for the embedded KR language and initialize the parser for use.
        Parameters:
        cs - is the ANTLRReaderStream to be used for parsing,
        sourceFile - is the source file
        Returns:
        the parser
        Throws:
        ExtendedParserException - if initialization fails

      • parseUpdate

        Update parseUpdate(java.lang.String pStr)
                   throws GOALParseException

        Convert string to Update. Used at run time to verify that percepts received from the environment can be inserted or retracted into the percept base.

        Performs all relevant checks to verify that the string provided is an update.

        Parameters:
        pStr - to be converted to DatabaseFormula
        Returns:
        Update corresponding to given string.
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - if string is no good update in our language.

      • getEmptySubstitution

        Substitution getSubstitution(null)
        Needed in MentalStateCondition#evaluate(MentalState, SteppingDebugger) and in MentalState#queryLiteral(languageTools.program.agent.msc.MentalLiteral, SteppingDebugger) .
        Returns:
        The empty substitution.

      • makeList

        Term makeList(java.util.List<Term> termList)
        Creates a language-specific Term containing an (ordered) list of Terms. Assumes the given Terms are for this KR language.
        Parameters:
        termList - The list of Terms to convert to a single Term.
        Returns:
        A Term containing the given Terms as a list.

      • makeExpressionGraph

        @Deprecated
ExpressionGraph makeExpressionGraph()
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an initial, language-specific ExpressionGraph.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - When this KRLanguage does not support building a graph (or the functionality has been turned off).

      • createDependencyGraph

        DependencyGraph<?> createDependencyGraph()
        Creates an empty, language specific DependencyGraph.
        Returns:
        Empty dependency graph for this KRlanguage.
